result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean D White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,300.00 and restitution surcharge. Restitution subject to defendant's right to challenge.
-------------------------
*AMENDMENT 05/23/2016 - Pursuant to Restitution Hearing held on 05/10/2016 and Order adopting Findings of Fact and Conclusions of law dated 05/18/2016, restitution is set at $0.00.

Pay court costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
------------------------------

No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent. No scrapping.
------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
------------------------------

timeConds.notes: with work release privileges to commence on or before May 13, 2016 at 8:00 a.m. Conditional jail time may be served in Rock County under electronic monitoring if available to the defendant.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean D White

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Findings of Fact and Conclusions of Law
Order Adopting Findings of Fact, Conclusions of Law from Restitution Hearing

Court in session at 11:13 am. Matthew Leusink appears for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock. Court addresses if restitution request is related to conviction. Court calls Dale Beyers who is duly sworn by clerk and responds to Court questions. Court to prepare Order. Court in recess 11:24 am.
AMENDED Motion for Hearing and Notice of Motion on Restitution Pursuant to Section 973.20 Stats
BOND QUASHED

2:33 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  
Parties advise the Court that they do have a joint agreement.  
Attorney Leusink makes a record with regard to victim notification.  

WITHHELD SENTENCE - 2 years probation
1)  Pay Court costs and DOC supervision fees
2)  Pay restitution in the amount of $3,300.00.  Restitution is subject to the deft's right to challenge.  
3)  Counseling as recommended by Agent
4)  No contact with victim without victim and agent's consent
5)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
6)  No scrapping.
7)  No weapons
8)  Ninety (90) days in the Walworth County Jail with work release privileges to commence on or before May 13, 2016.  Conditional jail time may be served in Rock County under electronic monitoring if available to the defendant.  

One (1) day sentence credit if probation is revoked

Statement by the Defendant
Court imposes the sentence agreed to by the parties.  
2:35 pm  Court in recess.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
DA Service Fees Invoice #52612   $60.00

2:34 p.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given. 
Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  
Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter is before the Court on a continued Motion hearing.  Briefs were submitted by the Attorneys.  Response by Attorneys.  
Court makes record / findings.  Court believes there was a fair probability that contraband or evidence of a crime would be found in the trunk, and there was therefore probable cause to seach the trunk.  
Court denies the Motion to Suppress.  
There is also an Other Acts Evidence that needs to be addressed.  
Defendant has a pending Burglary case in Waukesha County.  
Court does Sullivan analysis.  
Discussion between Court and Attorneys as to the first prong of the analysis.  
Court finds acceptable purposes to be identity, plan and intent
Court deals with next 2 prongs - whether the other act is relevant under s. 904.01 and whether the probative value is substantially outweighed by the danger of unfair prejudice.  
Argument by Attorney Rea.  
Argument by Attorney Hammock.  
2:50 p.m.   Court makes record.  Court finds that step 2 of Sullivan analysis has been met.  Court finds that the probative value is not outweighed by teh danger of unfair prejudice and finds step 3 has been met.
Court grants State's Motion to admit the other acts evidence.  Court will give a cautionary instruction if requested.  
2:53 p.m.  Court in recess.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 08:30 am. (2 days)
Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress Evidence
State's Letter Brief
Exhibit #1 / CD video recording from body camera

2:30 p.m.  Court in session.  Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  There are 2 motions before the Court - one for "suppression" and one for "other acts evidence".  Officer Gorecki did not get subpoenaed for today's motion hearing.  Court takes a short recess to allow Attorney Rea to speak with Sgt. Gorecki by phone.  Attorney Rea would still like to take testimony from Officer Kirsch today and would like to play a portion of the video - marked, offered, received as Exhibit #1. Exhibit #1 is published to the Court.  Officer Kirsch testifies on direct exam of Attorney Rea and cross by Attorney Hammock.  Court would like some briefing on this issue. Court establishes a briefing schedule.  State's Brief is due on 08/17/2015;  Defense Brief is due on 08/24/2015.  Court next addresses the other acts evidence motion.  Parties first discuss "similiarity".  Court notes that if the objects are to be suppressed, the Court can't consider if they are similar.  Both Attorneys agree.  Court will continue this for further hearing to a date after the Briefs are filed.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter in Court on Motion to Suppress and Other Act and Evidence. Court reschedules Motions. Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and and Motion to Suppress Evidence
Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
In Support of State's Motion to Introduce Evidence of Other Crimes, Wrongs, or Acts
To Introduce Other acts Evidence
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Motions due prior to status hearing on 05-20-2015

Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Rea appeared with Intern Andrew Herrmann for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant wishes to waive his preliminary hearing. Court goes over waiver form with the defendant. State has not filed an Information but informs the parties that the charges will mirror the criminal complaint.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sean D White in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):NO CONTACT WITH BEYER'S MACHINING OR ITS OWNER DALE BEYER OR ALTER METAL JANESVILLE WISCONSIN.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant in court in custody with attorney M. Nepomiachi for bond purposes only. Matthew Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
